name: Shishito Pepper Ice Cream
author: Dave
summary: This cool, creamy, homemade ice cream laced with a bit of heat from skillet-blistered shishito peppers is a great dessert to make for spice enthusiasts.
directions: Set a cast iron skillet over high heat
Dip peppers in oil to coat, then set in the hot skillet to blister, 30 seconds per side
Remove from the heat and sprinkle with salt
Blend peppers and sugar in a food processor until thoroughly combined
Combine pepper-sugar mixture, cream, milk, and milk powder in a saucepan over low heat
Cook and stir until sugar and milk powder have dissolved, 3 to 5 minutes
Whisk egg yolks in a small bowl
Add to the saucepan and cook, stirring occasionally until mixture reaches a temperature of 175 degrees F (80 degrees C), about 10 minutes
Pour ice cream base into a bowl, cover, and refrigerate 8 hours to overnight
Remove ice cream base from the refrigerator and strain out pepper fragments with a mesh sieve
Pour base into an ice cream maker and freeze according to manufacturer's instructions, about 20 minutes
Transfer to an airtight container and freeze until firm, about 4 hours
